title: [Large-Scale] Experiment-Based Problem-Solving Learning Utilizing Microfluidic Paper-Based Analytical Devices (μPADs)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary chemistry knowledge, general laboratory skills, and understanding of acid-base titration principles
context.additional_context: A 2-week (14-hour) blended course for nutrition education majors: 4 hours of online theory + 10 hours of offline lab practice.

learning_goals: Students can explain the principles and applications of μPADs
Students can design, fabricate microfluidic paper-based devices (μPADs), and perform acid-base titration experiments
Students improve data interpretation skills by comparing and analyzing results from traditional titration methods and μPAD experiments
Students can complete instructional designs for μPAD laboratory experiments tailored to secondary education institutions
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
